question: What does the unique() function do in a DataFrame when applied to a column?

answers.text: returns the number of unique columns

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The unique() function returns unique values not the number of unique values.

answers.text: returns the number of unique values in the given column

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: When the unique() function is applied to one column, it only processes values in the specific column.

answers.text: returns the unique values in the given column

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The unique() function when applied to a column returns the unique values (rows) in the given column.

detailedSolution: The unique() function when applied to a column returns the unique values (rows) in the given column.
